headline: New Boundaries = New Brain Wiring
body: Every boundary you keep tells your nervous system: you’re safe now. Keep the boundary—repattern the response.
prompt: What emotional pattern around boundaries could be softened this week with repetition and care?

headline: Boundaries Don’t Just Protect You—They Define You
body: The more clearly you set them, the more you meet yourself. You can’t belong to others if you don’t belong to you.
prompt: What dynamic in your life could benefit from boundary clarity—not to push away, but to come home to yourself?

headline: Boundaries Save Energy, Not Just Emotions
body: Your nervous system runs on limited fuel. Boundaries aren’t just emotional tools—they’re how you stop the leak.
prompt: What limit could you set this week that protects your energy—not just your time?

headline: It’s Not Just a No—It’s a Nervous System Reset
body: Every boundary drains or restores you. Learn when to engage—and when silence, space, or softness is the best line.
prompt: Where could you use less explanation—and more quiet confidence—in protecting your space this week?

headline: Collapse Isn’t Failure—It’s a Signal
body: You didn’t lose your boundary—you protected yourself the only way you knew. Now you get to reclaim your voice.
prompt: What collapsed boundary could you gently re-establish this week—not as revenge, but as repair?
